intro: Barleria quadriloba, commonly known as the four-leaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Barleria quadriloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
